byline.contributor: Tim Arango contributed reporting from Baghdad.

abstract: United States will rush 1,000 antitank rockets to Iraqi military, first step as Obama administration weighs difficult decisions in aiding beleaguered ally against Islamic State militants: deployment of weapons is intended to combat massive suicide vehicle bombs that ISIS used to capture provincial capital of Ramadi.
lead_paragraph: Obama officials have called the fall of Ramadi a huge setback, but have sought to quell critics in the region with the deployment of weapons, which are expected to arrive in early June.

headline.main: U.S. to Send Rockets to Iraq for ISIS Fight
headline.print_headline: U.S. Rushing Rockets to Iraq as a First Step

snippet: Obama officials have called the fall of Ramadi a huge setback, but have sought to quell critics in the region with the deployment of weapons, which are expected to arrive in early June.
